rule.name: Nested If
rule.description:
Reports classes with nested if loops.

Example of violations: 

    if(condition1 == true) {
        if(condition2 == false) {
            if(var1 > value) {//violation
                //do something
            }
        }
    }

rule.name: Class Size
rule.description: Checks if the size of a class exceeds the number of lines specified by the maxLines property.

param.description: The maximum number of lines allowed in a class definition.

rule.name: Parameter Count
rule.description:
Checks if the number of parameters in function exceeds the number of parameters specified by the maxParameters property.

Example of violations: 

    function void someFunction(arg1 : int, arg2 : int, arg3 : int, arg4: int, arg5 : int, arg6: int ) { // violation
    }

param.description: The maximum number of parameters in a function

rule.name: Commented Out Code
rule.description:
Avoid commented out code. It's distracting and takes away from readability of the code.

Examples of violations include: 

    /**
    if (false || value) { .. }
    return value && Boolean.FALSE
    **/

rule.name: find statement
rule.description:
Avoid performance intensive find statement. Use query builders instead.

Examples of violations include: 

    find(...)

rule.name: Incorrect use of getCount() == 0
rule.description:
Incorrect use of getCount() == 0

Examples of violations include: 

    getCount() == 0

rule.name: Incorrect use of uses statement
rule.description:
Incorrect use of uses statement

Examples of violations include: 

    uses x.y.z.*

rule.description:

rule.name: Incorrect use of semicolon (;)
rule.description:

rule.name: Incorrect use object equality
rule.description:
Incorrect usage of checking for object equality by using Objects themselves instead of PublicID

Examples of violations include: 

    if(myGroup == Group("pc:123")) {...}

rule.name: Loops should not be infinite
rule.description: Infinite loops can cause creation of unnecessary objects and often lead to heap memory leaks

rule.name: Neither Throwables nor Errors should be caught, only exceptions
rule.description: Catching Throwable or errors is a bad coding practice. Only Exceptions should be caught.

rule.name: Constants should not be defined in interface
rule.description: Do not define constant variables in an interface.

rule.name: Methods should not be empty
rule.description: Do not write a gosu method that is empty. Please delete the empty methods.
